task_description: Facing the building to your North-West (approx. 308°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: To estimate the building's height, I should first look up to see the top of the structure, as my current pitch is 0°.
I need to adjust my heading to align with the building's direction, approximately 308°NW, to properly assess its height.
To estimate the building's height, I should look up again to see the top of the structure from the correct heading.
I need to rotate my heading to 308°NW to align with the target building and then look up to see its full height.
With the correct heading and pitch, I can now assess the building's height; however, I need to move closer to get a better perspective.
I need to rotate my heading back to 308°NW to properly align with the building and reassess its height.
I should look up again to see the top of the building from the correct heading to estimate its height accurately.
I need to rotate my heading to 308°NW to align with the target building and then look up to see its full height.
With the correct heading and pitch, I can now assess the building's height; I estimate the height to be approximately 25 meters based on the visible structure.
